src:
Niko Kovač preživeo!
Hrvatski stručnjak će sigurno predvoditi Bavarce protiv Olimpijakosa i Dortmunda

03 Nov 2019

Tresla se ovog jutra Bavarska, rodio se ostanak Kovača. Hrvatski stručnjak će ostati šef stručnog štaba Bajerna, bez obzira što je debaklom od Ajntrahta u Frankfurtu ugrozio šampionske ambicije.
Trener Bajerna je, kao što ste već čitali, ovog jutra imamo sastanak sa igračima, zatim je odradio trening sa erezervistima. Za to vreme čelni ljudi nemačkog šampiona su sastanačali i raspravljali o Kovačevoj sudbini.
Ishod je (ne)očekivan. Hrvatski stručnjak je dobio poverenje da nastavi sa započetim poslom. Tako bar piše odlično upućeni novinar Manuel Bonke. Sigurno je da će Kovač biti na klupi Bajerna u sredu kada na Alijanc Arenu stiže Olimpijakos, kao i nekoliko dana kasnije kada će Bavarci odmeriti snage sa Dortmundom.
Dakle, Kovač će imati priliku da opere grehe. Međutim, još jedan negativan rezultat sasvim sigurno bi označio njegov rastanak sa Bajernom. Posebno, što ga dugo na piku ima Karl Hajnc Rumenige.
text:
Niko Kovac survived!
The Croatian expert will certainly lead the Bavarians against Olympiakos and Dortmund

03 Nov 2019

Bavaria was shaking this morning, the remnant of Kovacs was born. The Croatian expert will remain the head of Bayern's expert staff, despite jeopardizing his championship ambitions with the Eintracht debacle in Frankfurt.
Coach Bayern, as you have read, had a meeting with the players this morning, then did some training with the reservists. During this time, the leaders of the German champion met and discussed Kovac's fate.
The outcome is (not) expected. A Croatian expert has been given the confidence to continue the job started. At least that's what the excellent journalist Manuel Bonke writes. It is certain that Kovac will be on the bench of Bayern on Wednesday when Olympiakos arrives at the Alliance Arena, as well as a few days later when the Bavarians weigh in with Dortmund.
So the Blacksmith will have the opportunity to wash away sins. However, another negative result would surely mark his parting with Bayern. Especially, which Karl Heinz Rumenige has at his peak.
